update.description:
This PR adds command line support for logging record `--record [--record-path <path>]` and playback `--playback <path>`.

## Testing

### Record

1\. Normal case. No recorder `<plugin>` specified in SDF, `--record` triggers recording:

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f pose_publisher.sdf --record`

This records to default path in `LogRecord`, e.g. `~/.ignition/gazebo/log/<timestamp>`.

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f pose_publisher.sdf --record --record-path ./abc`

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f pose_publisher.sdf --record-path ./abc`

These record to the custom path specified in `--record-path <path>`. `--record-path` implies `--record`, the latter does not need to be separately specified.

2\. Edge case. Both recorder `<plugin>` and `--record` are specified. Only one recorder will be started, using the `<path>` specified in SDF \(or default if none specified\):

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f log_record_shapes.sdf --record`

Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

3\. Edge case. Specifying record and playback at the same time is ~~allowed, the playback will be recorded~~ not allowed, because currently the LogRecord plugin does not have access to the SDF being played back, it simply records an empty scene from `log_playback.sdf` in the first case and empty scene from default SDF in `Server.cc` in the second case. `--record` is ignored. An warning is printed. Playback is executed.

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f log_playback.sdf --record`

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r --playback /tmp/log --record`

### Playback

1\. Normal case. No SDF file specified, `--playback <path>` triggers playback:

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 --playback <path>`

Only small caveat is that, in the case that the recorded file uses ogre2, the playback appears brighter, because the default SDF in Server.cc uses ogre.

2\. Edge case. Both `-f file` and `--playback <path>` specified. An error is printed. This is not allowed,, because the `-f` file could be a very different world from the one that was recorded from. Since the SDF is already recorded anyway, the user should not need to specify another SDF.

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 -f lights.sdf --playback /tmp/log/`
update.title: [Acropolis] Logging command line support

content.raw: Thanks for the explanation, looks good the way it is
content.html: Thanks for the explanation, looks good the way it is

content.raw: Added in 7065f23

That's a decision we can make. Nothing is checking the return value right now. \(The refactor to `Start()` was really done because I implemented the command line arg a wrong way before, modeling ign-transport's way which required calling from bash. It's not really necessary anymore, but it makes the static `started` check cleaner.\)

I had it returning true to indicate that _any_ playback has started \(added a doxygen line for that\), which is parallel to the behavior of `Start()` in `LogRecord`, which is also not used. We could change the return value to `void`.

If we are going to allow multiple recorders running in the future and remove the `static started` flag though, then we might want to check the return value in the future.
content.html:
That's a decision we can make. Nothing is checking the return value right now. (The refactor to Start() was really done because I implemented the command line arg a wrong way before, modeling ign-transport's way which required calling from bash. It's not really necessary anymore, but it makes the static started check cleaner.)

I had it returning true to indicate that any playback has started (added a doxygen line for that), which is parallel to the behavior of Start() in LogRecord, which is also not used. We could change the return value to void.

If we are going to allow multiple recorders running in the future and remove the static started flag though, then we might want to check the return value in the future.

content.raw:
> in the future we may want to support that.

I think this may be possible after we publish the SDF on ign-transport and record it with the rest of messages to the .tlog file. That’s still a to-do item. I can try simultaneous record and playback after that is implemented.
content.html:
in the future we may want to support that.

I think this may be possible after we publish the SDF on ign-transport and record it with the rest of messages to the .tlog file. That’s still a to-do item. I can try simultaneous record and playback after that is implemented.

content.raw: Also here, I don't think it's needed
content.html: Also here, I don't think it's needed

content.raw: This could be initialized at declaration
How about only setting `started` to true in the end of the `Start` function, together with `instStarted`?
content.html: How about only setting started to true in the end of the Start function, together with instStarted?

content.raw: Should this return false?
Document param and return value
Nit: Missing the `////` before the function

> Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

I understand that we don't want 2 recordings to be triggered when the user only meant to start one. But there are use cases for making multiple recordings at the same time. For example, you may be recording the whole run, but also trigger smaller recordings throughout during runtime.

~~Gazebo-classic supports this either through the GUI or the `gz log --record` command line tool.~~ Actually, I take that back, it doesn't do what I would expect :grimacing:

How about adding some notes around `public: static bool started;` mentioning that this enforcement may be removed in the future?
content.html:
Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

I understand that we don't want 2 recordings to be triggered when the user only meant to start one. But there are use cases for making multiple recordings at the same time. For example, you may be recording the whole run, but also trigger smaller recordings throughout during runtime.

Gazebo-classic supports this either through the GUI or the gz log --record command line tool. Actually, I take that back, it doesn't do what I would expect

How about adding some notes around public: static bool started; mentioning that this enforcement may be removed in the future?

content.raw: Is this needed?

Maybe it's best not to print this here, because the path may be changed later and the final path will be printed anyway. For example, I'm getting this:

~~~
[Msg] Ignition Gazebo        v1.1.0
[Msg] Ignition Gazebo Server v1.1.0
[Msg] Recording states to /tmp/lalala
(...)
[Wrn] [LogRecord.cc:198] Log path already exists on disk! Recording instead to [/tmp/lalala(6)]
[Msg] Saved initial SDF file to [/tmp/lalala(6)/state.sdf]
[Msg] Recording to log file [/tmp/lalala(6)/state.tlog]
~~~
content.html:
Maybe it's best not to print this here, because the path may be changed later and the final path will be printed anyway. For example, I'm getting this:

[Msg] Ignition Gazebo        v1.1.0
[Msg] Ignition Gazebo Server v1.1.0
[Msg] Recording states to /tmp/lalala
(...)
[Wrn] [LogRecord.cc:198] Log path already exists on disk! Recording instead to [/tmp/lalala(6)]
[Msg] Saved initial SDF file to [/tmp/lalala(6)/state.sdf]
[Msg] Recording to log file [/tmp/lalala(6)/state.tlog]

content.raw: Small style detail, the `*` should be to the right, i.e. `sdf::World *sdfWorld`
content.html: Small style detail, the * should be to the right, i.e. sdf::World *sdfWorld

content.raw: Missing doxygen for `param[in]`

> Specifying record and playback at the same time is not allowed

I think  this is fine for now, but in the future we may want to support that. On Gazebo classic it was possible to run them at the same time to crop the original recording, or change its encoding for example.

> Only small caveat is that, in the case that the recorded file uses ogre2, the playback appears brighter, because the default SDF in Server.cc uses ogre.

Yeah that's an unfortunate caveat right now, ideally we'd be using the `<gui>` from the world being played back (#17).
content.html:
Specifying record and playback at the same time is not allowed

I think this is fine for now, but in the future we may want to support that. On Gazebo classic it was possible to run them at the same time to crop the original recording, or change its encoding for example.

Only small caveat is that, in the case that the recorded file uses ogre2, the playback appears brighter, because the default SDF in Server.cc uses ogre.

Yeah that's an unfortunate caveat right now, ideally we'd be using the <gui> from the world being played back (#17).

content.raw: Instead of repeating them, you could initialize the vector with the plugins that should always be loaded, and then append physics only if not playing back. Just to reduce duplication a bit.
content.html: Instead of repeating them, you could initialize the vector with the plugins that should always be loaded, and then append physics only if not playing back. Just to reduce duplication a bit.

content.raw:
Added in 8442afc

Small problem is that path is added as `<plugin ... path=''>` instead of `<plugin ...><path>...</path></plugin>`, which leads to a warning when played back. I think I'm using the wrong function \( `sdf::Element::AddAttribute()` \). What's the correct function to use in sdformat to add an attribute as the latter?
content.html:
Added in 8442afc

Small problem is that path is added as <plugin ... path=''> instead of <plugin ...><path>...</path></plugin>, which leads to a warning when played back. I think I'm using the wrong function ( sdf::Element::AddAttribute() ). What's the correct function to use in sdformat to add an attribute as the latter?

Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

3\. Edge case. Specifying record and playback at the same time is ~~allowed, the playback will be recorded~~ not allowed, because currently the LogRecord plugin does not have access to the SDF being played back, it simply records an empty scene from `log_playback.sdf` in the first case and empty scene from default SDF in `Server.cc` in the second case. An error is printed.

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f log_playback.sdf --record`

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r --playback /tmp/log --record`

### Playback

1\. Normal case. No SDF file specified, `--playback <path>` triggers playback:

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 --playback <path>`

Only small caveat is that, in the case that the recorded file uses ogre2, the playback appears brighter, because the default SDF in Server.cc uses ogre.

2\. Edge case. Both `-f file` and `--playback <path>` specified. An error is printed. This is not allowed,, because the `-f` file could be a very different world from the one that was recorded from. Since the SDF is already recorded anyway, the user should not need to specify another SDF.

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 -f lights.sdf --playback /tmp/log/`
update.title: [Acropolis] Logging command line support

content.raw: Fixed in de34b49. Artifact from a different implementation…
content.html: Fixed in de34b49. Artifact from a different implementation…

content.raw: Fixed in de34b49

update.description:
This PR adds command line support for logging record `--record` and playback `--playback <path>`.

## Testing

### Record

1\. Normal case. No recorder `<plugin>` specified in SDF, `--record` triggers recording:

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f pose_publisher.sdf --record`

This records to default path in `LogRecord`, e.g. `~/.ignition/gazebo/log/<timestamp>`.

2\. Edge case. Both recorder `<plugin>` and `--record` are specified. Only one recorder will be started, using the `<path>` specified in SDF \(or default if none specified\):

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f log_record_shapes.sdf --record`

Currently, it is enforced that only one recording instance is allowed to start during a Gazebo run.

3\. Edge case. This is allowed, the playback will be recorded:

`$ ign-gazebo -v 4 -r -f log_playback.sdf --record`

### Playback

1\. Normal case. No SDF file specified, `--playback <path>` triggers playback:

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 --playback <path>`

Only small caveat is that, in the case that the recorded file uses ogre2, the playback appears brighter, because the default SDF in Server.cc uses ogre.

2\. Edge case. Both `-f file` and `--playback <path>` specified. An error is printed. This is not allowed,, because the `-f` file could be a very different world from the one that was recorded from. Since the SDF is already recorded anyway, the user should not need to specify another SDF.

`$ ign-gazebo -r -v 4 -f lights.sdf --playback /tmp/log/`

content.raw: Document all params
Would it be too much trouble to also expose the `--record-path` in this PR? If it is, we can leave it for a future PR.
content.html: Would it be too much trouble to also expose the --record-path in this PR? If it is, we can leave it for a future PR.

content.raw: In the same place, you could pass a custom `SdfString` for playback which doesn't have the physics plugin.
content.html: In the same place, you could pass a custom SdfString for playback which doesn't have the physics plugin.

content.raw:
This function may be called multiple times, even for the same entity, because we let users load plugins at runtime. So maybe it's not the best place to put the logic to check if log plugins should be loaded.

My suggestion would be to add it at the `Server` constructor so it applies to all the simulation runners. You could do something like [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/242/acropolis-use-state-instead-of-pose-in/diff#Ltest/integration/network_handshake.ccT123) to append a `PluginConfig` to `ServerConfig`.
content.html:
This function may be called multiple times, even for the same entity, because we let users load plugins at runtime. So maybe it's not the best place to put the logic to check if log plugins should be loaded.

My suggestion would be to add it at the Server constructor so it applies to all the simulation runners. You could do something like this to append a PluginConfig to ServerConfig.
